title: Flag: Guinea-Bissau

adjectives: From or in the countryside or connected with it.
Of, from or pertaining to the countryside (adjective).
nouns: Country in Western Africa. Official name: Republic of Guinea-Bissau.
A country in Western Africa whose capital is Bissau.
A republic on the northwestern coast of Africa; recognized as independent by Portugal in 1974
Republic of Guinea-Bissau.
A former colony of Portugal and country in Africa, now called Guinea-Bissau.
A country in West Africa, formerly the colony of Portuguese Guinea
Guinea-Bissau, officially the Republic of Guinea-Bissau, is a country in West Africa.
A former colony in West Africa, what is now Guinea-Bissau
Country in Western Africa

Portuguese Guinea, called the Overseas Province of Guinea from 1951, was a West African colony of Portugal from the late 15th century until 10 September 1974, when it gained independence as Guinea-Bissau.
Emblem usually consisting of a rectangular piece of cloth of distinctive design
Piece of cloth.
A flag is a piece of fabric with a distinctive design that is used as a symbol, as a signaling device, or as decoration.
A piece of cloth, often decorated with an emblem, used as a visual signal or symbol.
Piece of fabric with a distinctive design
The capital of Guinea-Bissau
Capital city of Guinea-Bissau
Bissau is the capital city of Guinea-Bissau.
The capital of Guinea-Bissau.
Capital of Guinea-Bissau.
A nation in West Africa
Republic of Guinea.
Guinea, officially the Republic of Guinea, is a country in West Africa.
A republic in western Africa on the Atlantic; formerly a French colony; achieved independence from France in 1958
The official name of Guinea.
A person who originated from or is a citizen of Guinea.
French Guinea was a French colonial possession in West Africa.
Country in Western Africa whose capital is Conakry.
A former colony in West Africa, what is now Guinea
Country in Western Africa. Official name: Republic of Guinea.
1894-1958 possession in Northern Africa
Guinea .
The opposite of secession
As its original Latin term
Government
The collective body of a nation or state as politically organized, or as exercising political functions.
The territory of a nation, especially an independent nation state or formerly independent nation; a political entity asserting ultimate authority over a geographical area.

Nations is often used synonymously with ethnic group, but although ethnicity is now one of the most important aspects of cultural or social identity for the members of most nations, people with the same ethnic origin may live in different nation-states and be treated as members of separate nations for that reason.
Political organisation with a centralized independent government
The government.
An organized political community, living under a government
Nation has various meanings, and the meaning has changed over time.
A state is an organized community living under one government.
A political entity asserting ultimate authority over a geographical area.

A people permanently occupying a fixed territory bound together by common law, habits and custom into one body politic exercising, through the medium of an organized government, independent sovereignty and control over all persons and things within its boundaries, unless or until authority is ceded to a federation or union of other states.
The people who live in a nation or country
A politically organized body of people under a single government
A sovereign state.
A state is a nonphysical juridical entity of the international legal system that is represented by one centralized government that has supreme independent authority over a geographic area.
The geographic area under the control of a political state.

description: The flag for Guinea-Bissau, which may show as the letters GW on some platforms.
apple_vendor_description: The flag of Guinea-Bissau on Apple devices is presented with crisp detail and rich colors, featuring bold horizontal stripes of red and green, accented by a black star in a yellow vertical band. Appleâ€™s design language imbues the fabric with a subtle sheen and realistic folds, giving it a dignified and dynamic appearance. This emoji represents the nation of Guinea-Bissau, its people, and national pride, serving as a direct and respectful way to reference the country in global communication on Apple devices.
